Rely on Sears Home Services, the industry leader in home appliance repair services, for quick and reliable solutions that keep your LG double oven in tip-top working condition. Regardless of where you bought the double oven, we'll keep it cooking. Plus, we'll even offer a discount on a new double oven if you decide against repairs.
Our more than 1,500+ appliance repair technicians nationwide bring an average of 10 years of experience in appliance repairs for many major brands, such as Maytag, Whirlpool, Kenmore, Amana, Frigidaire, Samsung, Viking, KitchenAid, Thermador, Miele, Hotpoint, JennAir, and Bosch. Our double oven repair experts service hundreds of thousands of cooking appliances each year.
Sears Home Services also offers appliance maintenance plans to extend the life of your LG double oven, home appliance warranties to cover many repairs and replacement, and replacement parts for your double oven through Sears PartsDirect.
LG double oven repair issues we can handle
Regardless of the type of double oven you have, the appliance repair experts at Sears Home Services can perform quality LG double oven repairs for problems big or small. A service call involves diagnosing the appliance's malfunction and making repairs quickly. A repair technician can also recommend routine maintenance to extend your double oven's life.
Double oven won't turn on
There are various reasons your LG double oven won't turn on. If your double oven has power and the child lock is not engaged (if applicable), there are several possible problems.
Less expensive fixes include a damaged temperature sensor, infinite switch (electric) or igniter (gas), or a blown fuse. A more expensive repair is to replace the electronic control board which may have failed due to a power surge, a bake element that has shorted out, or some other system failure.
If it's a gas double oven and there's also a problem with your gas cooktop, there could be an issue with the house's natural gas line.
Double oven won't heat to right temperature
If your LG double oven won't heat to the proper temperature or is overcooking, undercooking, or cooking unevenly, the temperature sensor, temperature control thermostat, or the heating elements might need replacement, or the double oven may need to be recalibrated.
Double oven door won't close or unlock
If your double oven door won't close, it's likely a problem with the door's lock, seal, or hinges. If your double oven door won't unlock and you don't have a manual release, there could be an issue with the double oven temperature sensor, door lock assembly, or the electronic control board.
You can try disconnecting power to the appliance for 30 seconds to see if that will reset the control board and release the lock. In some double ovens, you can initiate the self-clean cycle, then cancel once the lock motor stops to try to reset.
Keep in mind that double ovens can take up to an hour to cool after self-cleaning, and the lock may not disengage until the double oven has completely cooled.
Double oven light won't turn on
Try replacing the bulb yourself. If that doesn't work, it's probably time to call an appliance repair expert. The problem could be a faulty socket, light switch, connecting wire, or electronic control board.
Preventive double oven maintenance
The most important thing you can do to prevent double oven malfunctions is to keep the interior of the double oven clean. Scheduling annual appliance service ensures your LG double oven will work efficiently and effectively. It can also prevent costly, unexpected repairs over time and extend the life of your appliance.
When you request the Kitchen Appliance Clean & Maintain package, your Sears Home Services technician will inspect your double oven and other kitchen appliances for proper functioning, wear and tear, and water or gas leaks, while also cleaning internal components.
Why choose Sears Home Services for LG double oven repair?
Our appliance repair experts know LG double ovens
Sears Home Services experts are certified in servicing LG double ovens, as well as double ovens and major appliances from other manufacturers. From regular maintenance to troubleshooting a major issue, our experienced double oven repair experts can help keep your appliance running smoothly.
Flexible scheduling
Breakdowns often occur unexpectedly. Sears Home Services provides flexible scheduling online or over the phone, making it easy to quickly set an appointment that's convenient for you, with same-day or next-day service in many locations.
Appointment updates
We know how helpful it is to receive confirmations or changes regarding your appliance service. When you've scheduled a LG repair appointment, you'll receive updates via your preferred method: text, email, or phone.
Protection plans
Appliances are an investment for your home. Sears Home Services warranties and protection plans can help ensure a long lifespan. Protect your LG double oven by asking your certified technician about our Appliance Warranty Plans.
LG Double oven repair FAQ
What types of double ovens does Sears repair?
The appliance repair experts from Sears Home Services can repair and maintain a wide variety of gas, electric or convection double ovens, including wall double ovens, and drop-in or slide-in double ovens.
Is it worth getting your LG double oven repaired?
If your LG double oven is more than 10 years old, consider replacing it when a major failure occurs because the double oven is nearing the end of its average useful life of 15 years. Otherwise, it's typically more economical to repair an double oven because replacement can be expensive.
The average cost to replace an double oven is $2,000, but the cost ranges from $750 for a low-end slide-in up to $3,000 or more for a wall-mounted double double oven with special features.
Are LG double oven repairs expensive?
Costs for a LG double oven repair can vary by the type of issue, and the parts and time required to complete the service. Your location can also affect the price.
The average double oven repair costs about $250, including the most common problem, a burner igniter. Replacing a bake element can cost as little as $200, but installing an electronic control board can cost more than $600.
If your double oven can't be repaired, you'll typically pay only a service appointment fee, and you'll be eligible for a discount on a new unit.
What is the best way to fix a broken LG double oven?
It's always smart to check your owner's manual troubleshooting section to see if there is a simple fix to your problem. If you're unsure, it's best to get help from an appliance repair service.
Our double oven repair technician will diagnose the problem quickly and complete the repair efficiently. Sears Home Services stocks a multitude of parts for many double oven brands.
What is the best way to find a LG double oven repair expert?
You can look for listings of local repair services, get a referral from a neighbor or friend, or check online reviews when searching for an appliance repair company.
You can trust the reputation of Sears Home Services built through millions of appliance service calls over decades. Our more than 1,500 technicians are located across the nation, so it's highly likely there's a repair technician in your area who is certified to fix your LG double oven.
What are the benefits of repairing a LG double oven?
Undoubtedly, the greatest economical benefit of repairing your LG double oven is the cost, especially if it's not too old.
Otherwise, as long as the problem isn't a health or safety hazard that requires replacement, weigh the cost of repair against the unit's age. There are also the environmental tradeoffs delaying replacement delays disposal, but new appliances are constantly updated to be more environmentally friendly and energy efficient.
Schedule your LG double oven repair appointment today
Experienced Sears Home Services appliance repair experts are certified specialists you can trust for all of your household appliance repair needs, including cooking appliance repair, dishwasher repair, washer and dryer repairs, and more.
For quality repairs or maintenance on LG double ovens or other brands, contact the appliance pros at Sears Home Service online or over the phone to schedule an appointment at a convenient time. RepairLG+Double Oven{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"BreadcrumbList","itemListElement":[{"@type":"ListItem","position":1,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair","name":"Repair"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":2,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/lg","name":"LG"},{"@type":"ListItem","position":3,"item":"https://www.searshomeservices.com/repair/double-oven-repair-service","name":"Double Oven"}]}LG Double Oven RepairWe're in your neighborhood, and we'll fix it no matter where you bought it.Schedule service your waySchedule NowCall(802) 552-4364ChatWill you be using repair benefits from a Sears or other warranty plan?LG double oven repair experts
Rely on Sears Home Services, the industry leader in home appliance repair services, for quick and reliable solutions that keep your LG double oven in tip-top working condition. Regardless of where you bought the double oven, we'll keep it cooking. Plus, we'll even offer a discount on a new double oven if you decide against repairs.
Our more than 1,500+ appliance repair technicians nationwide bring an average of 10 years of experience in appliance repairs for many major brands, such as Maytag, Whirlpool, Kenmore, Amana, Frigidaire, Samsung, Viking, KitchenAid, Thermador, Miele, Hotpoint, JennAir, and Bosch. Our double oven repair experts service hundreds of thousands of cooking appliances each year.
Sears Home Services also offers appliance maintenance plans to extend the life of your LG double oven, home appliance warranties to cover many repairs and replacement, and replacement parts for your double oven through Sears PartsDirect.
LG double oven repair issues we can handle
Regardless of the type of double oven you have, the appliance repair experts at Sears Home Services can perform quality LG double oven repairs for problems big or small. A service call involves diagnosing the appliance's malfunction and making repairs quickly. A repair technician can also recommend routine maintenance to extend your double oven's life.
Double oven won't turn on
There are various reasons your LG double oven won't turn on. If your double oven has power and the child lock is not engaged (if applicable), there are several possible problems.
Less expensive fixes include a damaged temperature sensor, infinite switch (electric) or igniter (gas), or a blown fuse. A more expensive repair is to replace the electronic control board which may have failed due to a power surge, a bake element that has shorted out, or some other system failure.
If it's a gas double oven and there's also a problem with your gas cooktop, there could be an issue with the house's natural gas line.
Double oven won't heat to right temperature
If your LG double oven won't heat to the proper temperature or is overcooking, undercooking, or cooking unevenly, the temperature sensor, temperature control thermostat, or the heating elements might need replacement, or the double oven may need to be recalibrated.
Double oven door won't close or unlock
If your double oven door won't close, it's likely a problem with the door's lock, seal, or hinges. If your double oven door won't unlock and you don't have a manual release, there could be an issue with the double oven temperature sensor, door lock assembly, or the electronic control board.
You can try disconnecting power to the appliance for 30 seconds to see if that will reset the control board and release the lock. In some double ovens, you can initiate the self-clean cycle, then cancel once the lock motor stops to try to reset.
Keep in mind that double ovens can take up to an hour to cool after self-cleaning, and the lock may not disengage until the double oven has completely cooled.
Double oven light won't turn on
Try replacing the bulb yourself. If that doesn't work, it's probably time to call an appliance repair expert. The problem could be a faulty socket, light switch, connecting wire, or electronic control board.
Preventive double oven maintenance
The most important thing you can do to prevent double oven malfunctions is to keep the interior of the double oven clean. Scheduling annual appliance service ensures your LG double oven will work efficiently and effectively. It can also prevent costly, unexpected repairs over time and extend the life of your appliance.
When you request the Kitchen Appliance Clean & Maintain package, your Sears Home Services technician will inspect your double oven and other kitchen appliances for proper functioning, wear and tear, and water or gas leaks, while also cleaning internal components.
Why choose Sears Home Services for LG double oven repair?
Our appliance repair experts know LG double ovens
Sears Home Services experts are certified in servicing LG double ovens, as well as double ovens and major appliances from other manufacturers. From regular maintenance to troubleshooting a major issue, our experienced double oven repair experts can help keep your appliance running smoothly.
Flexible scheduling
Breakdowns often occur unexpectedly. Sears Home Services provides flexible scheduling online or over the phone, making it easy to quickly set an appointment that's convenient for you, with same-day or next-day service in many locations.
Appointment updates
We know how helpful it is to receive confirmations or changes regarding your appliance service. When you've scheduled a LG repair appointment, you'll receive updates via your preferred method: text, email, or phone.
Protection plans
Appliances are an investment for your home. Sears Home Services warranties and protection plans can help ensure a long lifespan. Protect your LG double oven by asking your certified technician about our Appliance Warranty Plans.
LG Double oven repair FAQ
What types of double ovens does Sears repair?
The appliance repair experts from Sears Home Services can repair and maintain a wide variety of gas, electric or convection double ovens, including wall double ovens, and drop-in or slide-in double ovens.
Is it worth getting your LG double oven repaired?
If your LG double oven is more than 10 years old, consider replacing it when a major failure occurs because the double oven is nearing the end of its average useful life of 15 years. Otherwise, it's typically more economical to repair an double oven because replacement can be expensive.
The average cost to replace an double oven is $2,000, but the cost ranges from $750 for a low-end slide-in up to $3,000 or more for a wall-mounted double double oven with special features.
Are LG double oven repairs expensive?
Costs for a LG double oven repair can vary by the type of issue, and the parts and time required to complete the service. Your location can also affect the price.
The average double oven repair costs about $250, including the most common problem, a burner igniter. Replacing a bake element can cost as little as $200, but installing an electronic control board can cost more than $600.
If your double oven can't be repaired, you'll typically pay only a service appointment fee, and you'll be eligible for a discount on a new unit.
What is the best way to fix a broken LG double oven?
It's always smart to check your owner's manual troubleshooting section to see if there is a simple fix to your problem. If you're unsure, it's best to get help from an appliance repair service.
Our double oven repair technician will diagnose the problem quickly and complete the repair efficiently. Sears Home Services stocks a multitude of parts for many double oven brands.
What is the best way to find a LG double oven repair expert?
You can look for listings of local repair services, get a referral from a neighbor or friend, or check online reviews when searching for an appliance repair company.
You can trust the reputation of Sears Home Services built through millions of appliance service calls over decades. Our more than 1,500 technicians are located across the nation, so it's highly likely there's a repair technician in your area who is certified to fix your LG double oven.
What are the benefits of repairing a LG double oven?
Undoubtedly, the greatest economical benefit of repairing your LG double oven is the cost, especially if it's not too old.
Otherwise, as long as the problem isn't a health or safety hazard that requires replacement, weigh the cost of repair against the unit's age. There are also the environmental tradeoffs delaying replacement delays disposal, but new appliances are constantly updated to be more environmentally friendly and energy efficient.
Schedule your LG double oven repair appointment today
Experienced Sears Home Services appliance repair experts are certified specialists you can trust for all of your household appliance repair needs, including cooking appliance repair, dishwasher repair, washer and dryer repairs, and more.

It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.What is a Compressor?A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.What is a Condenser?A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.

LG double oven repair issues we can handle
Regardless of the type of double oven you have, the appliance repair experts at Sears Home Services can perform quality LG double oven repairs for problems big or small. A service call involves diagnosing the appliance's malfunction and making repairs quickly. A repair technician can also recommend routine maintenance to extend your double oven's life.
Double oven won't turn on
There are various reasons your LG double oven won't turn on. If your double oven has power and the child lock is not engaged (if applicable), there are several possible problems.
Less expensive fixes include a damaged temperature sensor, infinite switch (electric) or igniter (gas), or a blown fuse. A more expensive repair is to replace the electronic control board which may have failed due to a power surge, a bake element that has shorted out, or some other system failure.
If it's a gas double oven and there's also a problem with your gas cooktop, there could be an issue with the house's natural gas line.
Double oven won't heat to right temperature
If your LG double oven won't heat to the proper temperature or is overcooking, undercooking, or cooking unevenly, the temperature sensor, temperature control thermostat, or the heating elements might need replacement, or the double oven may need to be recalibrated.
Double oven door won't close or unlock
If your double oven door won't close, it's likely a problem with the door's lock, seal, or hinges. If your double oven door won't unlock and you don't have a manual release, there could be an issue with the double oven temperature sensor, door lock assembly, or the electronic control board.
You can try disconnecting power to the appliance for 30 seconds to see if that will reset the control board and release the lock. In some double ovens, you can initiate the self-clean cycle, then cancel once the lock motor stops to try to reset.
Keep in mind that double ovens can take up to an hour to cool after self-cleaning, and the lock may not disengage until the double oven has completely cooled.
Double oven light won't turn on
Try replacing the bulb yourself. If that doesn't work, it's probably time to call an appliance repair expert. The problem could be a faulty socket, light switch, connecting wire, or electronic control board.
Preventive double oven maintenance
The most important thing you can do to prevent double oven malfunctions is to keep the interior of the double oven clean. Scheduling annual appliance service ensures your LG double oven will work efficiently and effectively. It can also prevent costly, unexpected repairs over time and extend the life of your appliance.
When you request the Kitchen Appliance Clean & Maintain package, your Sears Home Services technician will inspect your double oven and other kitchen appliances for proper functioning, wear and tear, and water or gas leaks, while also cleaning internal components.

full_content.content: It's always smart to check your owner's manual troubleshooting section to see if there is a simple fix to your problem. If you're unsure, it's best to get help from an appliance repair service.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Our double oven repair technician will diagnose the problem quickly and complete the repair efficiently. Sears Home Services stocks a multitude of parts for many double oven brands.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: What is the best way to find a LG double oven repair expert?
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: You can look for listings of local repair services, get a referral from a neighbor or friend, or check online reviews when searching for an appliance repair company.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: You can trust the reputation of Sears Home Services built through millions of appliance service calls over decades. Our more than 1,500 technicians are located across the nation, so it's highly likely there's a repair technician in your area who is certified to fix your LG double oven.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: What are the benefits of repairing a LG double oven?
full_content.attributes: {"node":"[object Object]","class":"text-left text-xl-plus leading-5 lg:leading-7 text-blue-300 lg:text-2xl-plus font-medium pt-1 pb-4"}

full_content.content: Undoubtedly, the greatest economical benefit of repairing your LG double oven is the cost, especially if it's not too old.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Otherwise, as long as the problem isn't a health or safety hazard that requires replacement, weigh the cost of repair against the unit's age. There are also the environmental tradeoffs delaying replacement delays disposal, but new appliances are constantly updated to be more environmentally friendly and energy efficient.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: Experienced Sears Home Services appliance repair experts are certified specialists you can trust for all of your household appliance repair needs, including cooking appliance repair, dishwasher repair, washer and dryer repairs, and more.
full_content.attributes: {"class":"text-gray-500 text-sm md:text-md font-normal leading-6 font-montserrat text-left my-2"}

full_content.content: For quality repairs or maintenance on LG double ovens or other brands, contact the appliance pros at Sears Home Service online or over the phone to schedule an appointment at a convenient time. For urgent repairs, appointments can be made for same-day or next-day service in many locations.

full_content.content: Glossary TermsWhat is the drum of the washing machine?The drum is the core part of the washer that holds your laundry and enables the cleaning process through rotation, agitation, and rinsing.What is a 608 Certification?The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.What is a Compressor?A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.What is a Condenser?A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.

self.__next_f.push([1,"# LG double oven repair experts

Rely on Sears Home Services, the industry leader in home appliance repair services, for quick and reliable solutions that keep your LG double oven in tip-top working condition. Regardless of where you bought the double oven, we'll keep it cooking. Plus, we'll even offer a discount on a new double oven if you decide against repairs.  

Our more than 1,500+ appliance repair technicians nationwide bring an average of 10 years of experience in [appliance repairs for many major brands](/repair/appliance-brands-we-repair), such as Maytag, Whirlpool, Kenmore, Amana, Frigidaire, Samsung, Viking, KitchenAid, Thermador, Miele, Hotpoint, JennAir, and Bosch. Our double oven repair experts service hundreds of thousands of cooking appliances each year.

Sears Home Services also offers [appliance maintenance](/maintain/appliance-maintenance) plans to extend the life of your LG double oven, home appliance warranties to cover many repairs and replacement, and replacement parts for your double oven through [Sears PartsDirect](https://www.searspartsdirect.com/category/1234576/wall-oven-parts).

## LG double oven repair issues we can handle

Regardless of the type of double oven you have, the appliance repair experts at Sears Home Services can perform quality LG double oven repairs for problems big or small. A service call involves diagnosing the appliance's malfunction and making repairs quickly. A repair technician can also recommend routine maintenance to extend your double oven's life. 

### Double oven won't turn on

There are various reasons your LG double oven won't turn on. If your double oven has power and the child lock is not engaged (if applicable), there are several possible problems. 

Less expensive fixes include a damaged temperature sensor, infinite switch (electric) or igniter (gas), or a blown fuse. A more expensive repair is to replace the electronic control board which may have failed due to a power surge, a bake element that has shorted out, or some other system failure. 

If it's a gas double oven and there's also a problem with your gas cooktop, there could be an issue with the house's natural gas line. 

### Double oven won't heat to right temperature

If your LG double oven won't heat to the proper temperature or is overcooking, undercooking, or cooking unevenly, the temperature sensor, temperature control thermostat, or the heating elements might need replacement, or the double oven may need to be recalibrated. 

### Double oven door won't close or unlock

If your double oven door won't close, it's likely a problem with the door's lock, seal, or hinges. If your double oven door won't unlock and you don't have a manual release, there could be an issue with the double oven temperature sensor, door lock assembly, or the electronic control board. 

You can try disconnecting power to the appliance for 30 seconds to see if that will reset the control board and release the lock. In some double ovens, you can initiate the self-clean cycle, then cancel once the lock motor stops to try to reset.

 Keep in mind that double ovens can take up to an hour to cool after self-cleaning, and the lock may not disengage until the double oven has completely cooled.

### Double oven light won't turn on

Try replacing the bulb yourself. If that doesn't work, it's probably time to call an appliance repair expert. The problem could be a faulty socket, light switch, connecting wire, or electronic control board. 

### Preventive double oven maintenance

The most important thing you can do to prevent double oven malfunctions is to keep the interior of the double oven clean. Scheduling annual appliance service ensures your LG double oven will work efficiently and effectively. It can also prevent costly, unexpected repairs over time and extend the life of your appliance. 

When you request the [Kitchen Appliance Clean & Maintain package](/maintain/appliance-maintenance), your Sears Home Services technician will inspect your double oven and other kitchen appliances for proper functioning, wear and tear, and water or gas leaks, while also cleaning internal components.

## Why choose Sears Home Services for LG double oven repair?

### Our appliance repair experts know LG double ovens 

Sears Home Services experts are certified in servicing LG double ovens, as well as double ovens and major appliances from other manufacturers. From regular maintenance to troubleshooting a major issue, our experienced double oven repair experts can help keep your appliance running smoothly. 

### Flexible scheduling

Breakdowns often occur unexpectedly. Sears Home Services provides flexible scheduling online or over the phone, making it easy to quickly set an appointment that's convenient for you, with same-day or next-day service in many locations.

### Appointment updates

We know how helpful it is to receive confirmations or changes regarding your appliance service. When you've scheduled a LG repair appointment, you'll receive updates via your preferred method: text, email, or phone.

### Protection plans

Appliances are an investment for your home. Sears Home Services warranties and protection plans can help ensure a long lifespan. Protect your LG double oven by asking your certified technician about our [Appliance Warranty Plans](/home-warranty). 

## LG Double oven repair FAQ

### What types of double ovens does Sears repair?

The appliance repair experts from Sears Home Services can repair and maintain a wide variety of gas, electric or convection double ovens, including wall double ovens, and drop-in or slide-in double ovens.  

### Is it worth getting your LG double oven repaired?

If your LG double oven is more than 10 years old, consider replacing it when a major failure occurs because the double oven is nearing the end of its average useful life of 15 years. Otherwise, it's typically more economical to repair an double oven because replacement can be expensive. 

The average cost to replace an double oven is $2,000, but the cost ranges from $750 for a low-end slide-in up to $3,000 or more for a wall-mounted double double oven with special features. 

### Are LG double oven repairs expensive?

Costs for a LG double oven repair can vary by the type of issue, and the parts and time required to complete the service. Your location can also affect the price. 

The average double oven repair costs about $250, including the most common problem, a burner igniter. Replacing a bake element can cost as little as $200, but installing an electronic control board can cost more than $600. 

If your double oven can't be repaired, you'll typically pay only a service appointment fee, and you'll be eligible for a discount on a new unit. 

### What is the best way to fix a broken LG double oven?

It's always smart to check your owner's manual troubleshooting section to see if there is a simple fix to your problem. If you're unsure, it's best to get help from an appliance repair service. 

Our double oven repair technician will diagnose the problem quickly and complete the repair efficiently. Sears Home Services stocks a multitude of parts for many double oven brands.

### What is the best way to find a LG double oven repair expert?

You can look for listings of local repair services, get a referral from a neighbor or friend, or check online reviews when searching for an appliance repair company. 

You can trust the reputation of Sears Home Services built through millions of appliance service calls over decades. Our more than 1,500 technicians are located across the nation, so it's highly likely there's a repair technician in your area who is certified to fix your LG double oven.   

### What are the benefits of repairing a LG double oven?

Undoubtedly, the greatest economical benefit of repairing your LG double oven is the cost, especially if it's not too old. 

Otherwise, as long as the problem isn't a health or safety hazard that requires replacement, weigh the cost of repair against the unit's age. There are also the environmental tradeoffs delaying replacement delays disposal, but new appliances are constantly updated to be more environmentally friendly and energy efficient. 

## Schedule your LG double oven repair appointment today

Experienced Sears Home Services appliance repair experts are certified specialists you can trust for all of your household appliance repair needs, including cooking appliance repair, dishwasher repair, washer and dryer repairs, and more. 

For quality repairs or maintenance on LG double ovens or other brands, contact the appliance pros at Sears Home Service online or over the phone to [schedule an appointment](/scheduler/shs?serviceType=R&productName=Double%20Oven) at a convenient time. For urgent repairs, appointments can be made for same-day or next-day service in many locations."])

self.__next_f.push([1,"In this article, we’ll describe how a garage door sensor works so you can effectively fix problems on your own and know when to call in professional [garage door opener repair](/repair) help.

## How Does a Garage Door Sensor Work?

A garage door opener safety sensor includes these components:

* Emitter module.
* Receiver module.
* Wiring that connects the modules to the logic board in the garage door opener motor unit.

The emitter and receiver modules are connected to the rails of the garage door with brackets. They’re positioned about 6-inches above the ground to detect foreign objects or obstructions in the path of the closing garage door to prevent injuries or damage to the garage door.

The emitter gets power from the logic board and wires. It sends an infrared beam of light from the emitter to the receiver module. If the receiver module doesn’t detect the infrared beam because the beam is blocked by a person or object while closing the garage door, the opener will reverse the direction of the door and open it back up. The lights will typically blink (often 10 times) when the sensors detect an obstruction between the infrared beams.

The garage door opener will also reverse the door and blink the lights if the emitter and receiver modules are misaligned and the receiver module isn’t detecting the infrared beam from the emitter module.

![how-to-align-the-garage-door-opener-safety-sensors](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/3WSCJlOWGLgzR7ZW3JvXrR/4dfe444efc9c4d59f2477479c68fa10c/aligning-a-garage-door-opener-safety-sensor-image.png)

## How to Align Garage Door Opener Safety Sensor

Lights on the emitter and receiver modules help you align the safety sensors so they work properly.

The emitter module typically has a yellow light that should be lit all of the time. The receiver module has a green light that turns on when the receiver detects the emitted infrared beam because the modules are aligned and unblocked by any obstructions.

When aligning the sensors, make sure the yellow emitter light is on and adjust the positions of the emitter and receiver modules until the green light turns on – indicating that the infrared beam is aligned.

## How to Tell When Something’s Wrong

The first key to knowing that something is wrong with the safety sensor is that the garage door won’t close using the opener. When you activate the garage door opener to shut the garage door, the door may begin to close and then reverse and move back to the fully open position. The lights on the garage door opener motor unit will often blink, indicating an obstruction in the safety sensor beam path or that the sensors aren’t aligned.

Remove the obstruction or realign the sensor in this situation.

If the door doesn’t move at all, the sensor may not be connected properly through the wires to the motor unit or the sensors may be defective. Wiring between the motor unit and the sensors or a bad logic board on the garage door opener could also be causing this failure.

## Troubleshooting Garage Door Sensor Problems

To troubleshoot this garage door opener problem, follow the expert tips in this popular video from Sears PartsDirect that has over 1 million views:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/D1-jABFaOLU" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

If you’re unable to find and fix the garage door opener failure on your own, schedule [garage door opener repair](/repair) service and we’ll send a technician to your home to diagnose the issue and get your garage door opener working again.

Sometimes, you may encounter an intermittent problem with the garage door opener sensors – especially on clear winter days when sunlight reflects off snow and ice to interfere with the infrared sensing beams. When you suspect this type of problem is preventing the garage door from closing properly, install garage door opener sun shields as shown in this helpful video:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iFJd5n6MEX0" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

## Maintaining Your Garage Door and Opener

Keeping your garage door and its opener well-maintained are key to their smooth operation. Problems with the door can jostle the safety sensors out of alignment or cause wiring problems. Checking the garage door opener regularly will ensure its safe operation.

### Garage Door Maintenance

Here's a handy garage door maintenance checklist:

* __Inspect and clean the garage door tracks:__ Begin by visually inspecting the tracks for signs of wear or damage. Clean any dirt or debris to ensure smooth operation and prevent the door from jamming.
* __Lubricate moving parts:__ Use a silicone-based lubricant to reduce friction and ensure smooth operation of hinges, rollers, and springs. Wipe off any excess lubricant to prevent accumulation of dirt and debris.
* __Check garage door springs:__ Garage door springs play a crucial role in balancing the door weight. Inspect them for signs of damage like rust or fraying. If you find any issues, it's best to seek professional help for spring adjustments or replacements.
* __Inspect the garage door lock:__ Test the garage door lock operation. Lubricate parts if necessary. Replace any worn or broken parts. You’ll rarely use the garage door lock when you have a garage door opener installed, but you want to be sure it works if and when you do need it.

### Garage Door Opener Maintenance

Here are essential tips to help keep your garage door opener well-maintained and working safely:

* __Test the safety sensors:__ Ensure that safety features like sensors and the auto-reverse function are working correctly. You can test the safety sensors by placing an object in the door's path and ensuring the door reverses and goes back up when you activate the garage door opener to close the door. If these features are malfunctioning, troubleshoot the problem as discussed above or contact a [garage door opener repair](/repair) professional.
* __Check the auto-reverse function:__ To test the auto-reverse safety function of your garage door opener, you can: 
     * Make sure the garage door is fully open.
     * Place a 1.5 inch thick board or a 2x4 on the floor in the center of the garage door .
     * Press the remote or wall button to close the door.
     * The door should stop and reverse when it hits the board. If not, adjust the downforce setting as described below or have the garage door opener repaired or replaced by a professional.
* __Check the garage door opener downforce setting:__ Some garage door openers use small dials on the motor unit to control the downforce when closing the garage door. Make sure that the downforce is not set too high. Excessive downforce is dangerous and can cause property damage or injury to anything caught in the path of door. Close the door with the opener and carefully grab it with your hand when the door is halfway down to make sure that the downforce isn't excessive. If you can stop the door using your hand, then no further adjustment is necessary. If you’re unable to stop the door with your hand, reduce the downforce in small increments. Make adjustments until the door closes completely on its own but will still stop if you catch it halfway down. Here’s a YouTube video that illustrates how to adjust force settings on common garage door openers:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WI-vVCS-0jo" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

If your garage door opener has a battery backup, test the battery. To test the battery, unplug the garage door opener; the battery status LED light should glow solid orange, indicating the opener is running on battery power. If the LED light flashes, that means it’s time to replace the battery because the battery power is low.

Maintenance and safety checks for your model of garage door opener may differ from the procedures described above. Check your owner’s manual for information about maintenance specific to your garage door opener.

Regular [garage door maintenance](https://www.searsgaragedoors.com/repairs) not only extends your garage door's lifespan and keeps it operating safely, but also helps avoid unexpected breakdowns.
"])

self.__next_f.push([1,"![turn-off-the-refrigerator-dispenser-child-lock](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/59mQHo6jZj2q78AdkoIhxa/322748bb521d647fce838949e25ce16f/refrigerator-dispenser-locked-image.png)

## Turn Off the Dispenser Child Lock

Check to see if the child lock feature on the dispenser is turned on. If it is, the water and ice dispenser  won’t work.

Turn the child lock feature off if you find it enabled. For most fridges, you’ll need to press and hold the dispenser button marked with the lock icon label for 5 seconds.

After turning off the child lock, the water dispenser (and ice dispenser) should work again.

---

![check-for-frozen-water-reservoir](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/7KhNA6qVX7vP2RgIoCBxEz/db674e7c187f3419243d902b5c63d7b6/refrigerator-water-dispenser-reservoir.png)

## Check for a Frozen Water Supply Line or Frozen Water Reservoir

In the back of some refrigerator compartments, behind the crisper drawers, you’ll find a water reservoir or coiled up section of water tubing that cools down water for the water dispenser.

A frozen line or frozen reservoir can prevent the water dispenser from getting water. Check for a frozen water line or reservoir and thaw the freeze using a hair dryer on a low heat setting.

This tactic may fix the water dispenser.

---

## Check the Water Supply

Check to see if the ice maker is getting water. Empty the ice bin into a container and store that ice in the freezer. Once the ice maker cycles a dumps a batch of ice, see if the ice mold is filled with water to make a new batch of ice or see if the ice maker dumps a second batch of ice.

If the ice maker is getting water and making ice, then you know that the water supply going to the refrigerator is okay.

If the ice maker isn’t getting water, replace the water filter if you haven’t replaced it within the last 6 months. This may restore the water supply.

If the water filter isn’t the problem, check the water supply going to the fridge using this procedure:

1. Shut off the water supply cut-off valve for the refrigerator.
2. Disconnect the water supply line from the back of the refrigerator.
3. Place the end of the water supply line in a bucket and briefly open the water supply cut-off valve.

If water doesn’t flow from the end of the water line, have a plumber fix the water supply going to the refrigerator.

If water flows from the end of the water supply line, then you know that the house water supply for the refrigerator is okay.

---

![check-the-refrigerator-water-valve](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/28QaHepQAqYgtpv9aLunf6/8934882ce37114d2e18b66d4b12ae4b4/replacing-the-refrigerator-inlet-water-valve.png)

## Examine the Inlet Water Valve

If the water supply going to the refrigerator is okay, then __unplug the fridge__ and check the wire harness connection on the inlet water valve.

Reconnect the inlet water valve wires if you find them loose or disconnected.

If the wire harness connection is okay, then a bad water inlet valve could be preventing the water dispenser and ice maker from getting water. Other failures such as a damaged internal wire or bad control component could keep the water inlet valve from working. 

Schedule [refrigerator repair](/repair/refrigerator-repair-service) service to have a technician check the water valve circuit. The tech will need to conduct a live voltage check to see if the valve is getting voltage when you press the dispenser lever. If the valve is getting voltage but not opening to supply water to the water dispenser and ice maker, then the technician will replace the water inlet valve.

If you suspect that the water valve is defective and you want to replace it yourself without further diagnosis, follow the steps in this video to install a new water inlet valve:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tU4UK2ELxOM" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Replacing the inlet water valve without a full diagnosis of the problem is a risk but it may fix the water dispenser failure.

---

![disassembled-water-dispenser](//images.ctfassets.net/e0821f6q5nel/I1NwsyW8DCZeU6v1k93vO/38da94c94c6128014b0d7cd5a25714b8/disassembled-refrigerator-dispenser.png)

## Water Dispenser Control Problems

A failed micro-switch or bad dispenser control board can prevent the water dispenser working.

When the troubleshooting steps outlined above don’t help you fix a water dispenser failure, schedule [refrigerator repair](/repair/refrigerator-repair-service) service to inspect the dispenser components and find the cause of the failure.

## How to know if your refrigerator water valve is bad

A service technician will check to see if the valve is getting electrical current when actuated. If the valve coil is getting current but doesn’t open, the technician will replace the water valve. This type of live voltage check isn’t safe for DIY’ers. To check the water inlet valve on your own, unplug the refrigerator and check the resistance through the water valve solenoid coil using a multimeter. The meter should typically measure 200 to 500 ohms of resistance if it’s good. If the meter measures infinite resistance, replace the water valve because it is bad.

### Cost to replace a water inlet valve on a refrigerator

If you can replace the water inlet valve yourself, then all that you’ll spend is the price of the replacement part – typically between $20 and $100. If you need to have a service technician replace the valve, that repair will typically cost you between $150 and $300.

### Life expectancy of a water valve

Refrigerator water valves typically last 15 to 20 years but a failure in this type of device can occur at any time.

---

Knowing about the different types of failures that can prevent your refrigerator water dispenser from working will help you determine the right corrective action to take.

Although you can fix some fridge water dispenser issues on your own, more complicated failures will require a visit from a technician.

When you need a technician to fix your refrigerator water dispenser, trust [Sears Home Services](/repair) to get the job done. We have experienced technicians that will get your dispenser fixed quickly and reliably.

---
"])

self.__next_f.push([1,"## How Much Does It Cost to Replace a Dishwasher?

Understanding the factors that influence the cost to replace a dishwasher can help you make an informed choice and stick to your budget.

### Dishwasher Types and Prices

The cost is primarily determined by the type of dishwasher you opt for. Built-in, portable, and drawer dishwashers are the most common types, with built-in models typically ranging from $400 to $1,500, portable models from $400 to $800, and drawer dishwashers often priced from $800 to $2,000.

### Cost to Install a New Dishwasher

The cost to install a new dishwasher is another crucial factor. This cost can fluctuate based on the complexity of the installation among other factors. On average, professional installation costs range from $150 to $500. However, it's recommended to get a quote from a trusted service provider for an accurate estimate.

If you intend to install the new dishwasher yourself, you can save a few hundred dollars but understand that DIY dishwasher installation involves risks. Failing to properly install the dishwasher can cause leaks that will damage cabinets and flooring in your kitchen. 

### Potential Additional Expenses

Additional expenses may arise during the dishwasher replacement process, such as removal and disposal of the old unit, necessary accessory purchases, and potential adjustments to the plumbing or electrical systems. It's advisable to factor these into your budget when estimating the overall replacement cost.

Disposal of the old unit often costs at least $50 for haul away. A new fill hose for your dishwasher can cost between $25 and $40 for most models. A dishwasher power cord kit can cost up to another $20.

By considering these factors, you can get a clearer picture of how much it will cost to replace a dishwasher. Sears offers a [wide range of high-quality dishwashers](https://www.sears.com/upgrade) along with special financing offers to help you find the perfect dishwasher for your budget. We also have the [accessories](https://www.searspartsdirect.com/collections/kitchen-appliance-accessories) you need to install the new dishwasher.

## Why Replace Your Dishwasher?

Replacing your dishwasher brings several benefits. A new unit can provide improved energy efficiency, better cleaning performance, and access to modern features and technology.

Older dishwashers often consume more water and electricity, leading to higher utility bills. A newer model can help reduce these costs. Also, modern dishwashers offer enhanced cleaning performance with powerful jets and specialized cleaning cycles, eliminating the need for pre-rinsing or handwashing. Moreover, replacing your dishwasher gives you access to the latest features, including adjustable racks, flexible loading options, and customizable wash cycles.

## DIY or Professional Dishwasher Replacement?

When considering the cost to install a new dishwasher, you may wonder whether to do it yourself or hire professionals. DIY installations can save on labor costs and be a rewarding experience for those handy with home improvement projects. However, they require expertise, and mistakes can lead to water damage or improper functioning. To get an idea of what’s involved in dishwasher installation, view this video that shows how to pull a dishwasher out of the counter to replace the heating element:

<iframe width="660" height="371" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ft7lXDPCEug" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Having a clear understanding of what’s involved when pulling a dishwasher out and installing a new one will help you decide if this task is something you can do yourself. If you’re not completely confident that you can safely pull your old dishwasher out and install the new one, opt for professional installation service. 

Professional installation ensures that experienced technicians handle the task, reducing the risk of mistakes. Professionals can also provide advice on dishwasher use and offer warranties for further protection. Proper installation is crucial for optimal dishwasher performance and for maintaining the manufacturer's warranty.

## Choosing the Perfect Dishwasher

You’ll be faced with hundreds of choices when buying a new dishwasher. When considering the cost of a new dishwasher, it's not just about the initial price. You should also consider the size and capacity, and understand the different features available. Energy efficiency and water usage are also factors that you should consider. At Sears, we offer a wide variety of high-quality dishwashers, and our experts can help you find the perfect one for your home.

Select the dishwasher model that fits your budget and has the features you need. 

## How to Save Money on Dishwasher Replacement

There are several ways to save money on dishwasher replacement without compromising on quality. Comparing prices from different retailers, taking advantage of seasonal sales and promotions, and exploring financing options or rebates can all help reduce the overall cost of your dishwasher replacement. At Sears, we offer a wide range of dishwasher options to fit any budget. We also offer special financing options to help you seamlessly replace your dishwasher in no time. [Shop for your new dishwasher on our Sears.com page](https://www.sears.com) to find the perfect dishwasher and financing to fit your needs.
